alert.note: Alert for Ferry; Pend Oreille; Stevens (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 22 at 5:26AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: .Slow moving storms will be capable of producing heavy rainfall over areas that see storms redevelop throughout the day. Steep terrain and especially burn scars will be most susceptible to debris flows along with flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Northeast Washington, including the following counties, Ferry, Pend Oreille and Stevens. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage areas. Debris flows are possible in steep terrain and near burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - High levels of atmospheric moisture associated with the remnants of Hurricane Hilary are forecast to impact northeast Washington. Periods of moderate to heavy rainfall are possible through Tuesday evening, with enhanced rainfall rates due to embedded thunderstorms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
